let's get started I'm going to use for

pat dry and place nightly in a saucepan

2 tbsp of sugar then gently shake the
pan and
let the sugar melted our medium heat and

started to turn into caramel color add 1
tablespoon of minced garlic and 1
tablespoon of minced shallot and fry
until fragrant this should be done
really quick because you don't want your

then produce garlic shallot caramel
mixture into the fish
next thing abroad is of one tablespoon
of sugar and 4 tbsp of fish sauce and
then on to the fish
also add some pepper and let the fish
marinate for at least thirty minutes or
better one to two hours if you have time
now over high heat to bring the
marinated fish to Briah
if the fish body is too little equipped
you can add half a cup of hot water or

swirl the saucepans to coat the fish
evenly in the caramel sauce then a
stinking strips or hot pepper if you
like spicy then turn the heat to low and

turn the fish over we'll have a spatula
now the fish is very fragile at this
stage so handle with care okay the sauce
pan on the clay pot should have enough
space for the fish other way is going to

now continue to simmer on low heat and
cook for another 20 to 30 minutes until
the sauce thickens
finally you can top up with some chopped
spring onion to garnish and some more
black pepper on top
surprisingly after being cooked for more
an hour the fish has become firmer and
